name: Pan-Fried Salmon Cakes
author: Bibi
summary: If you ever have leftover salmon, this recipe is a way to repurpose, reuse, and recycle! Bonus: Even my son, who doesn't really care for salmon, loved these cakes!
ingredients: ¼ cup minced red bell pepper
¾ cup crushed saltine crackers, divided, or as needed
directions: Stir egg, Dijon mustard, mayonnaise, Worcestershire sauce, salt, and pepper together in a large bowl
Add red bell pepper, onion, and parsley; mix well
Gently stir in salmon and 1/2 cup crushed crackers
Form the mixture into 8 cakes; lightly coat each side with additional 1/4 cup crushed crackers
Heat olive oil and butter over medium heat in a 12-inch skillet
Fry salmon cakes until golden brown, about 4 minutes per side
Transfer cakes to a plate lined with a paper towel to drain
